name: Snagit Theme
summary: Learn about .SNAGTHEME files and view a list of programs that open them.

content: After taking a screenshot with Snagit's capture tools, you can add text, arrows, callouts, and other annotations to that screenshot. Many of these annotations can be themed, to ensure they appear with a consistent color scheme and style.

For example, if you plan to add both text and an arrow to a screenshot, you can select the Industrial theme and use its presets to ensure both elements use the same color and style. You can also use themes across multiple images, to ensure elements appear consistently in all those images.
To create your own SNAGTHEME file:
Open a tool from which you can select themes (such as the Text tool).
Click the theme dropdown (Windows) or gear icon (Mac) and select New Theme....

description: A SNAGTHEME file is a theme used by TechSmith Snagit, a screen capture and image annotation program. It contains JSON data that specifies the theme's included colors, font, and style. SNAGTHEMES give a consistent look to text and shapes placed in screen captures.

instructions: To import a SNAGTHEME file into Snagit:
Open Snagit and select a tool that uses themes (such as the Text tool).
Click the theme dropdown (Windows) or gear icon (Mac) and select Import....
Navigate to and open your SNAGTHEME file.
If you want to view the JSON data your SNAGTHEME file contains, you can open it in Microsoft Notepad, Apple TextEdit, or any other text editor.
To edit a theme you've imported into Snagit:
Open a tool from which you can select the theme.
Click the theme dropdown (Windows) or gear icon (Mac) and select Edit....
To export a theme as a SNAGTHEME file:
Click the theme dropdown (Windows) or gear icon (Mac) and select Export Theme....
